intro: Pentacalia ocanensis, commonly known as the Ocanes mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue, purple, and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
